item.title: The Deconstructed Church
item.description:
The Deconstructed Church

The Emerging Church Movement is here to stay. So say researchers Gerardo Marti and Gladys Ganiel in their new book, The Deconstructed Church: Understanding Emerging Christianity . I'm looking forward giving it a careful read and drawing on their research as I reflect on my study of New Seattle Churches.

item.title: Practical Theology Programs
item.description:
Practical Theology Programs

Since I couldn't find a good list of schools with PhD programs in Practical Theology (US) anywhere on the web, I made my own: Boston University School of Theology A PhD in Practical Theology with concentrations in homiletics, liturgical studies, mission, evangelism, mission and evangelism, pastoral theology, spirituality, church and society, congregational studies and religious education.

item.title: Third Places and/as Sacred Spaces
item.description:
Third Places and/as Sacred Spaces

Seattle is home to a number of new churches that are embodying their belief that the gospel is good news to neighborhoods. Seeking to incarnate the Kingdom of God, they fashion themselves as a tangible assets to their community.

item.title: How to Live in the Kingdom of God
item.description:
How to Live in the Kingdom of God

The Kingdom (or Reign) of God is the realm in which God's will is actualized. Thus heaven is a part of the Kingdom of God, angels are citizens in the Kingdom, animal life and all creation (generally speaking) are within the Kingdom of God.
